byline.contributor: Myra Noveck contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

abstract: Israel releases Palestinian prisoner Khader Adnan, who was being held indefinitely without formal charges, for fear that he could die in prison after 55-day hunger strike; Adnan is spokesman for militant group Islamic Jihad and had once before achieved release from Israeli prison with hunger strike protest.
lead_paragraph: It was the second time that the prisoner, Khader Adnan, had successfully used a hunger strike as a tactic against the Israeli penal authorities.

headline.main: Worried That Fasting Palestinian Prisoner Could Die, Israel Releases Him
headline.print_headline: Worried That a Fasting Palestinian Prisoner Could Die, Israel Releases Him

snippet: It was the second time that the prisoner, Khader Adnan, had successfully used a hunger strike as a tactic against the Israeli penal authorities.
